title: Web Applications with node.js and React
content: Welcome! This is the documentation for building web application using Electrode X for node.js and React. In this quick start guide, we will show you how to create and run your first app.

title: Requirements
content: Install the node.js version 12.x.x or laterWe recommend a tool such as nvm for managing node.js installations.If you are on Windows, then universal nvm is recommended.

title: Creating Your First App
content: Note: our packages are published under the npm scope @xarc To create your first Electrode X app: npx @xarc/create-app my-appCopy Wait for this to complete. The console will display the following with some instructions: Created react/node webapp in directory 'my-app'. To start development, please run:Copy Follow the instructions outlined in the console.When complete, open your browser to http://localhost:3000To stop the DEV server, press Q Your new electrode app will appear as shown below.

title: The Packages
content: Essentials#  Package Description @xarc/app node.js runtime support; should be in dependencies @xarc/app-dev development only support; should be in devDependencies @xarc/react react.js support  Optionals#  Package Description @xarc/react-redux react redux support @xarc/react-query react query support @xarc/react-router react router support @xarc/create-app create a starter app for you with npx @xarc/opt-postcss Extra style support @xarc/opt-stylus stylus support @xarc/opt-sass sass support @xarc/opt-less less support @xarc/opt-jest jest support @xarc/opt-karma karma support @xarc/opt-mocha mocha support
